snippet: The C.I.A. money, President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan told reporters, was “an easy source of petty cash,” and he suggested that some of it was used to pay off warlords and power brokers.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai says Central Intelligence Agency has assured him that it will  continue dropping off stacks of cash at his office despite criticism that has erupted since payments were disclosed; says money is 'easy source of petty cash' and some it was used to pay off members of political elite, group dominated by warlords.

byline.contributor: Rod Nordland and Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The C.I.A. money, President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan told reporters, was “an easy source of petty cash,” and he suggested that some of it was used to pay off warlords and power brokers.

headline.seo: Karzai Said He Was Assured of Cash Deliveries by C.I.A.
headline.main: Karzai Says He Was Assured C.I.A. Would Continue Delivering Bags of Cash
headline.print_headline: Karzai Says He Was Assured C.I.A. Cash Would Keep Coming
